subject: AI & Agents
title: Data Versioning: Track What Changed
description: A 60-second lesson on Data Versioning: Track What Changed.

hook.text: The model degraded after retraining. Was it the code or the data that changed?

buildup.text: Data versioning tracks changes to datasets the same way Git tracks code changes.

discovery.text: DVC (Data Version Control) stores data separately but links it to code commits.

twist.text: Without data versioning, reproducing a past experiment is nearly impossible.

climax.text: Version your data, your features, your labels, and your splits. All of them.

punchline.text: You version code. Version your data too.

quiz.question: What does DVC (Data Version Control) track?
options: Dataset changes linked to code commits
